data:
Persuader: Hello, how are you today?
	Persuadee: Hello, I am doing fine.
Persuader: I am here on behalf of Save the Children, have you ever heard of this organization?
	Persuadee: No, what is it?
Persuader: Save the Children is an international non-governmental ogranization that promotes children's rights, provides relief, and helps support children in developing countries. Have you ever donated to any international children charities?
	Persuadee: Yes, I have donated to a few before.
Persuader: That's great to hear! We are here looking to see if you would be interested in donating part or all of your incoming payment for this task to our organization! Your donation would go directly to helping children receive food and education in locations where they are in desperate need of help. Would this be something you would be interested in?
	Persuadee: Yes, this sounds good. Is there a specific or minimum amount necessary?
Persuader: That's great! Thank you! There is no minimum amount necessary, whatever you feel like you would like to donate to go towards the cause.
	Persuadee: I would be interested in donating $0.10 of my payment to Save the Children.
Persuader: Thank you! We appreciate that! Is there a certain area that you are passionate about that you would like to see the donation go towards?
	Persuadee: I would love if it can go towards children in war-torn regions like Syria.
Persuader: That's a great cause to donate to, we have a team working with them now getting them healthy food they need in their time of need. While I have you here would you also like to be signed up for our email newsletter? That way you can stay up to date on what we are working on and any current needs we may have.
	Persuadee: No thank you, I would rather just follow your social media. What sites are you available on, if any?
Persuader: You can find us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, and even Youtube. Here is a link to our Facebook account if you wouldl ike to check us out and give us a follow!  URL 
	Persuadee: Thank you. Are you doing anything regarding the situation with children at the US Border?
Persuader: We are working hard with protecting the children experiencing the events happening at the U.S. Border. You can read about any updates and any other causes we are working towards on our website,  URL 
	Persuadee: I see on your site that almost 90% of donations go straight towards your programs. That is very good, I can feel better knowing my money is used right.
Persuader: Definitely, and we thank you again for donating. Just to confirm you wanted to donate $0.10 of your payment for this task today, is that correct?
	Persuadee: Yes, $0.10 is correct.
Persuader: Thank you and have a great night, we hope to see you again soon.

data:
Persuader: yes
	Persuadee: how are you?
Persuader: It is good
	Persuadee: That's good. I'm doing good as well.
Persuader: What do you think of this charity?
	Persuadee: I think it is pretty good. What about you?
Persuader: It think it is a terrible idea.
	Persuadee: Why do you think that?
Persuader: Charity such as this does not actually pull people out of poverty.
	Persuadee: Well it does help somewhat. I don't think that anything will pull people completely out of poverty. It's a hand up.
Persuader: It is good on a basic humanitarian level. The money could be far better spent in opening up their native countries to the global system of trade. The west has spent trillions in aid over the last 60 years in Africa and do not have anything to show for it.
	Persuadee: That is true. The poor are barely left to survive while the rich get richer. It's a sad truth.
Persuader:  There is nothing morally wrong with the rich getting richer. In the last 10 years those rich people have invested in the global trade system and brought over a billion people out of the world poverty threshold. In the world there is an elite segment of the population that provides most of the value for society, they should be the ones with the lion share of the resources. This is because the only way they can obtain a large amount of wealth in the first place is to make hundreds, thousands, and millions of mutually beneficial transactions.
	Persuadee: That's a valid point. What do you think can help?
Persuader: Greater free trade between countries and the ability for poor people to have access to sources of micro finance and capital goods so that many of them can invest in tools that make themselves more productive and cap dig their way out of poverty. 
	Persuadee: That would be good for the world. There's no reason for us to not have free trade really. I think most people would give anything to get out of poverty if given a chance.
Persuader: What are your thoughts on the donation amount?
	Persuadee: I want to donate $0 I need money for myself.
Persuader: Lol, there is no argument that your own personal economic activity would not do more good than this charity. 
	Persuadee: I'm broke as it is. That's why I'm here. lol

data:
Persuader: Hello, how are you?
	Persuadee: Hello, I'm doing great and yourself?
Persuader: Very well thank you.  Do you have a moment for me to tell you of the good deeds of the Save the Children charity?
	Persuadee: I have a moment to spare. Go ahead.
Persuader: Are you familiar with the organization, perhaps from television or a class collection when you were in school?
	Persuadee: Yes I am. A family member told me about, but I never got around to donating. 
Persuader: We had a family friend two, she had several pictures on her refrigerator of a few children she sponsored.  Some of them for many years.  I was always sad of the presentation of the poorly dressed child holding empty plate in the ads.  Are you aware of the other things the organization does for kids? 
	Persuadee: I've never really looked into it, could you give me some more information?
Persuader: Yes! Besides the usual schooling and basic healthcare many of us are familiar with, Save the Children also assists communities during natural disasters such as earthquakes, they try to help communities with economic opportunities, and they event get involved with child intervention in area of war such as Syria or other parts of the world that are experiences in influx of refugees. 
	Persuadee: You don't say. I'm getting really interested in donating from the information you gave me. What do you think would be a good starting donation?
Persuader: That's fantastic!  It is truly my belief that any gift is a good gift and not knowing your history or situation, I would not ask of you what you could not comfortably provide.  Any deed on behalf of Save the Children is good vibes from the universe.  Also, did you know that April 15, 2019 Save the Children will be 100 years old!!!!!   It could be a birthday present!!!!
	Persuadee: Thats a great idea! I think I'll start saving now. I'll donate $100 for next year to celebrate! 
Persuader: Are you sure you couldn't even toss over a lucky penny for 2018?  The day of innocence which is the day to donate to Save the Children happens on December 28th? 
	Persuadee: I think at the moment I can start with about $20 towards it. 
Persuader: Wow, that would be a whole bucket of lucky pennies!!!  I'm telling you, a gift like that will give you warm fuzzy feelings for the rest of the year.  It's like the little kids who collect coins in the little milk carton type boxes at halloween.  I don't know if you remember those.  I remember bringing them to school and turning them over for the charity.  I felt like a badass little kid, if there could be such a thing. 
	Persuadee: I remember do that as well as a kid. I always felt great. I hope my small donation gives another child job as well
Persuader: I hope so to.  Just remember any time next year, 5 years from now you can always go to their website and make a donation    URL   I really appreciate you making a donation today.  You are the bomb!!!!
	Persuadee: Thank you for the infomation! You were a great help.
Persuader: No, thank you!  The children and staff of Save the Children thank you too!  It's folks like you that will allow the organization to go another 100 years!  
	Persuadee: I hope so. I feel like just donating is thanking them too for surviving so long. 
Persuader: I know, can you imagine.   We are lucky people in this country...yes, we have our struggles but to never have famine or to live where shots or bombing are constant....yes, let's thank the universe for giving them the strength of survival.  Thanks again, have a great day.  Sending you appreciation vibes through the universe!!!

data:
Persuader: You should donate to Save the Children. Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
	Persuadee: how much of my money donated will go to the children? 
Persuader: Whatever amount you choose will go to the children. 
	Persuadee: okay I will donate $2
Persuader: Excellent! I'm glad that you've decided to donate to help save the children. However, for the purposes of this HIT, we need to reach a minimum of 10 chat turns. I believe both of us should have 8 left. 
	Persuadee: Okay are we supposed to talk about the charity? 
Persuader: According to their website, 86% of funding went directly to program services. That means more of your dollar is directly contributing to saving the children.
	Persuadee: great, do you know what countries the children are from? 
Persuader: Save the Children actually has several programs in the USA. They also have programs in many countries around the world. In fact, it might be easier to mention where they DON'T operate. 
	Persuadee: Will you be donating also? 
Persuader: I will indeed. I'll be donating so that the children get the maximum benefit. 
	Persuadee: I am happy to hear that the donations are used programs in the USA as well as abroad.
Persuader: It's pretty amazing. According to the website, they help 157 million children in 120 countries. 
	Persuadee: I saw on the website you can donate through amazon. That makes it easy for people like me. 
Persuader: They also have ways to donate investments and IRA distributions. So there's many different options for however people prefer donating. 
	Persuadee: That is interesting, I have never heard of that way to donate. 
Persuader: Yeah, it's pretty thorough. So, just to confirm, you'll be donating $2 to Save the Children?
	Persuadee: Yes, I will donate $2
Persuader: Excellent! Your contribution will make a difference in someone's life. Thank you so much and have a good day. 
	Persuadee: THank you, you have a great day as well.

Persuader: Have you thought about how important it is to save children?
	Persuadee: Yes. I work in the field of fundraising and am exposed to organizations that help children.
Persuader: Have you heard about the specific organization "Save the Children"?
	Persuadee: Yes, I have. My company did work for them years ago.
Persuader: So you know that they are a no-government organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries?
	Persuadee: Yes, I do.
Persuader: Would you be interested in donating to them?
	Persuadee: I may be interested.
Persuader: If you did, your donation could make a huge impact in children's lives.
	Persuadee: I understand that.
Persuader: The research team who put this together is collecting donations to send to Save the Children.
	Persuadee: Okay. How much have they collected?
Persuader: I'm not sure what the total is currently.
	Persuadee: Oh, okay. How do I know that this is legit?
Persuader: Well, you don\'t have to "mail" or give out banking info. Instead, you can agree to give a portion of your payment. It\'s directly deducted from your task payment.
	Persuadee: Ah, I see.
Persuader: You have the option of donating between $0 to all of your payment ($2).
	Persuadee: I will donate a portion of it.
Persuader: That's awesome! How much would you like to donate?
	Persuadee: I would like to donate $0.25.
Persuader: Great, thank you so much!

data:
Persuader: Hello. How are you? 
	Persuadee: I'm doing well. It's getting late, it's been a long week. How are you?
Persuader: I'm doing good. I understand about the long week. Thank goodness it's the weekend. 
	Persuadee: That's right! I'm actually up and at it bright and early to take a road trip for a family member's birthday tomorrow... joy. What do you have planned for the weekend?
Persuader: We're planning to hit the beach, but it's a shame that there are so many kids in poverty who won't be able to enjoy the beach or birthday parties. Don't you agree?
	Persuadee: That really is a shame. I was fortunate enough to grow up 10 minutes from a beach regardless of my financial situation, but so many kids have no means to even take public transportation to a beach if they wanted to. Very unfortunate. I always hope those kinds are able to make a better situation of their lives as they get older to make up those experiences.
Persuader: I agree. We live near the beach right now too, and it's great. My kids are so fortunate to be living a life so far removed from war zones like kids in Syria. And, to have their basic needs met to be able to enjoy their childhood. Have you heard of Save the Children?
	Persuadee: I'm sure I have, but could you give me a refresher?
Persuader: It's an awesome nonprofit that helps fight for children's rights all over the world.  URL has a lot more information. 
	Persuadee: I'll have to dig further into it. Do you know anything about who runs it? My biggest concerns with organizations like that is there isn't a ton of transparency as to where donation funds actually go.
Persuader: Oh, I totally understand. I feel like most of those organizations take the money and run. Save the Children actually has 86% of the money that is donated directly helping the children. It's listed on Forbes list of top 50 charities. 
	Persuadee: Wow, that's great. I consider Forbes pretty trustworthy. I appreciate you getting that info for me. I'll have to dig further into their mission statements and activities. Some of that stuff can get so political!
Persuader: They also have their annual financial report actually listed on their website which I think is pretty impressive for a charity organization. Would you consider donating part of your pay for this task to Save the Children?
	Persuadee: I would, but I think I'd have to review all of their documentation first and then possibly even donate on my own time! That's not to say I'm uninterested, I just like to trust and verify.
Persuader: I understand. It's important to do research before giving money to organizations. This one just seems like they're doing a lot of great work helping children in the U.S. and abroad. And, it would be so easy to have your payment taken directly from your task payment.
	Persuadee: 100% agreed. I'll have to dig into their information and make a decision. Have you donated to them before or do you plan to?
Persuader: I haven't in the past, but after reading more about them I definitely plan to. Their credentials are outstanding. And, I like that so much of their proceeds actually go to help. I've seen some awful numbers from organizations like Goodwill who claim to be helping but all of their money actually goes to their CEO's.
	Persuadee: You think Goodwill is bad, look at some of the reports on Susan G Komen--BREAST CANCER of all things. What starts with a good intention doesn't always end up that way. Does Save The Children specifically aim to help Syrian chidren?
Persuader: Oh, really? I haven't heard about Susan G Komen being so bad, I will have to look into that. I did a race of theirs about 10 years ago. 
	Persuadee: I can\'t speak for 10 years ago, but I know recently they were found out to have so much of their money going to "marketing" that a massive portion of their proceeds never even made it to research. That\'s off the top of my head, but it\'s rough. I\'ve done a Donna race before, though.
Persuader: That's awful. That's why I'm pleasantly surprised to see that Save the Children has such a high percentage of donations being used. And, no. They don't only help in Syria. They support kids all over the world by helping them get healthcare, education, making sure their safe, etc. I'm going to donate part of my proceeds. I think you should too!

data:
Persuader: Hi there.  How are you doing today?
	Persuadee: im good thank you for asking, how are you?
Persuader: Pretty good.  Spent some time off mTurk, so this is my first day back! How much time do you spend on here?
	Persuadee: I am here almost daily but just here and there when i have time
Persuader: Do you have kids?
	Persuadee: yes, do you?
Persuader: Just one, but she's grown now and lives half way across the country.  How old are yours?
	Persuadee: mine are small still (: 
Persuader: This is a good way to help fund that! Kids are so expensive!
	Persuadee: yes! very true 
Persuader: Have you ever heard of Save the Children? They have a lot of ads on daytime TV.
	Persuadee: no, i dont have cable 
Persuader: Ah.  That's probably just as well.  They're an organization that has been around forever and does a lot of work with children in impoverished and war-torn countries. I've never donated myself, but we're going to have an opportunity to donate some of our earnings as part of this exercise.
	Persuadee: Interesting, Do you believe that these children actually get help from this charities? Because I hope so, but not sure.
Persuader: Yeah, I always wonder about that myself. I think that with Save the Children, they've been around long enough and have a good enough reputation that I trust them. I have to say, I was on their website and saw what they're doing for kids in Syria.  I didn't know that over 1000 children have been killed or injured there as part of the violence.  It just breaks my heart.  As hard as things were for me, raising my daughter as a single mom, at least we didn't have to worry about getting shot.
	Persuadee: Yes, that is very true! Very heartbreaking stuff goes on around this world. Like you said we are very blessed to not have to always worry about bombs being dropped on top of us. 
Persuader: There was that whole poison gas thing there, too.  Do you think you'd be willing to give part of your payment for this task to help deal with that? After all, it's just a little bit of money that we've earned just sitting here chatting.
	Persuadee: yes, i think i may. how about you?
Persuader: Yeah.  I guess I'd feel kind of guilty if I didn't. How much would you be willing to give? I think we can choose any amount from $0 to all of our payment.
	Persuadee: I dont know, but i would def feel guilty too if i didnt after this chat we just had
Persuader: Haha.  Me too.  I guess I'm going to say that I'll donate the whole thing. It's not like I'm going to come up with anything better to do with whatever little bit of money we make from this.  How about you?

data:
Persuader: Hi how are you doing?
	Persuadee: Hello I am well, how are you doing?
Persuader: I am good, wasting away my saturday doing surveys.  
	Persuadee: You and me both, trying to hit my number so I can do something else
Persuader: Number?  Do you set a quota for yourself?
	Persuadee: Yeah, I try to do 15-20 dollars a day. Need the extra income
Persuader: Oh, that's a good idea.  How long does it usually take you?
	Persuadee: 2 to 3 hours usually depends. weekends are always slower
Persuader: I'm noticing that.  I just started, this is my third day.  How long for you?
	Persuadee: about 4 months. I would try to perform this task with the 10 questions if you would like to get this bonus.
Persuader: Yep.  I did this one earlier.  I was on the other side though.  I take it you\'ve done it before?  So you do you know about "Save the Children?"
	Persuadee: No, I\'m not sure what exactly is "Save the Children"?

data:
Persuader: Hey, have you heard about Save the Children?
	Persuadee: the charity right?
Persuader: Yeah. Pretty much what they do is use donations from charitable, and caring citizens to help children around the world get on a better path to the future.
	Persuadee: Oh. Well I think that the donations that go there are supporting a good cause. Especially for hungry children without food and water
Persuader: So true. On top of that, they have full financial disclosure of their donations. About 86% goes to program services for less-fortunate kids, and the 14% goes to Fundraising and Management (Personally, I'd like to the latter number go down in the future).
	Persuadee: Do you think too many people are donating to their charity? Why say that when they are being helped?
Persuader: Not exactly. Just like any charity, they need to get money for operating costs, so not every single cent goes to the children unfortunatley. But 86% is a lot compared to other organizations.
	Persuadee: Ah i see. So like for administration. I just read an article saying that not all donations are going to the right children; specifically to the less unfortunate. Would you ever consider donating to them knowing these facts?
Persuader: It depends to be honest. You've got to understand that the organization needs money to stay operating, or else they would fail and no children would be helped. Make sense?
	Persuadee: I understand that. I don't disagree with anything they do since children are being helped
Persuader: That's true, have you donated to a charity before?
	Persuadee: no not that i remember of
Persuader: I didn\'t before either, but recently I\'ve been giving little bits here and there when I can. I think of it like... "What would make me happier? A $1 cup of coffee or using that $1 to help someone in need." It truly is a rewarding experience.
	Persuadee: hmm I'd love to donate if I was in a financially secure, but at the moment I don't think I can even spare a dollar. I do support all the donations going to the charity though.
Persuader: Trust me, I understand haha. I'm in the same situation. But if you had the opportunity now to donate a $1 to Save the Children, you wouldn't? It'd be deducted from the task payment today. If that's too much even $0.50 will help out the children that really need. And hey, maybe someday those kids grow up to be some of the most generous, caring people in the world.
	Persuadee: If its from today I guess I wouldn't mind.
Persuader: Yeah, it's kind of like money that's not in your pocket yet haha. So, to be fair, I'll let you decide the amount of today's payment (0-$2) that gets donated, since you'll be the one making a difference.
	Persuadee: Yeah. I'll go ahead and go with $0.50. Every penny counts. In the future, I would like to donate much more, its one of the promises I've made to myself
Persuader: That's awesome! We need more people like you. Would you like me to provide you with some more information about Save The Children (just the link)? That way, when we both have a little extra money, years and years in the future, we can hope to help out more children
	Persuadee: not a problem. I'd appreciate it.
Persuader:  URL . Thank you again, and have a great day

Persuader: Good Evening, how are you?
	Persuadee: I am doing well how about yourself?
Persuader: I'm very well, thank you. Are you ready for fall?
	Persuadee: I am so ready! Me and the heat are not friends and this electric bill is killing my pockets! What about you?
Persuader: About the same. I have more purposeful things to use that money on.  I enjoy donating once in awhile to charities.  Do you or Have you?
	Persuadee: No I do not donate. I am a single mother supporting 3 children by myself. I am usually the one in need of a charity. I am working on finishing my last 2 classes before I graduate with my bachelors in psychology so that hopefully one day soon I will be able to donate to a charity. 
Persuader: Oh wow, sounds much similar to my story.  I too almost have my Bachelor's in Psych. only I have 4 courses left. I was forced to leave my job because of a rare heart condition.  I develolped this after my 5th little girl was born.  I'm glad there was a support group and charity/group to help me out.  
	Persuadee: I am sorry to hear about your heart condition and 5 children??? I would die!!!! I am loosing hair with the 3 I have! My mother was just diagnosed with breast cancer and she did not have any charity to help her. Me and my sister did a yard sale to help her with hospital bills
Persuader: So sorry to hear that.  Cancer is awful!!  Have you ever heard of Save the Children?  If you'd be interested, you can look over the website and let me know if you'd like to donate any portion of your 
	Persuadee: Save the children sounds wonderful... Yet right now I am up late doing this because I am in need for my children. My daughters birthday is today and I know she is only 3 but she is wanting a cake and a few cheap presents and I am trying to make sure I can do that for her. I will look into donating when I can afford to 
Persuader: You can actually donate just five cents of your money you make from this survey if you'd like?
	Persuadee: I am only receiving so much from this survey. So as much as I would love to I would not like to donate at this time.
Persuader: Okay, that is understandable.  I am in your same situation.  
	Persuadee: But I appreciate you introducing me to this charity. and I hope I won't ever need their hep but I might one day so when I can I will look into donating to this cause
Persuader: Yes, it is a great cause and maybe you can keep this charity in mind should you run across it again in the future.
	Persuadee: I will be sure to remember considering my children mean everything to me. 
Persuader: Same here.  It makes me angry/sad that there are so many who are going hungry and I can't help feed more.
	Persuadee:  It is not fair that majority of the worlds money belongs to less than 1 percent of the US, yet there are children starving.
Persuader: Yes, I agree.  Children should be the number one priority
	Persuadee: Yes they are our future.
Persuader: Are you sure I can't persuade you for five cents of your $2.00 payment for this charity before I let you go?  You can feel accomplished even though you know you are already a great human!!

	Persuadee: Can I sign up for 6 months, and make monthly payments?

data:
Persuader: Hello. How are you today?
	Persuadee: Doing pretty well, thanks.
Persuader: Glad to hear it. Are you someone who has ever donated to a charity or offered your time for a charitable cause?
	Persuadee: Yes. I have done both.
Persuader: I'm glad to hear that. Charity is very important. Can I ask what kind of organizations you have donated to?
	Persuadee: A variety ... mostly health related causes.
Persuader: Those are very good causes. Have you ever heard of the organization Save the Children?
	Persuadee: Yes but I don't know much about it. 
Persuader: Save the Children Promotes children's rights, provides relief, and helps support children in developing countries. They work in the US and internationally. 
	Persuadee: That sounds like a very worthy cause.
Persuader: It is. More impressively, 86% of all expenditures go to program services so donations are used for the cause rather than allocated to profits. 
	Persuadee: That is pretty impressive but I would rather see more than 90 percent of donations go directly to helping the children.
Persuader: I can understand that. But given that it is an international organization, there is overhead that must be paid for such as travel. This organization is especially helpful in countries where there is a lack of support for children in war zones such as Syria. 
	Persuadee: I know international travel is expensive but having 14 percent of the donations going to overhead seems a bit high to me.  It should be no more than 10 percent max.
Persuader: I understand. But many organization are too scared to go into countries like Syria where children are facing extreme violence. In the first 2 months alone, 1,000 children were killed or injured there. Save the Children does help in this country and others like it. 
	Persuadee: I can understand that but I have seen too many examples of charities where the money is not spent wisely.
Persuader: I can see your concern, but please know that this is a very worthy cause. How much do you like to donate to the charity now? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment ($2).
	Persuadee: I would say 40 cents
Persuader: Thank you so much for your generosity. It will be put to very good use. 
	Persuadee: okay.

	Persuadee: There are just so many people to help everywhere it can be kind of overwhelming. It's important to give to all kinds of organizations when we can.

	Persuadee: Yeah that is definetly a hard thing to wrap my head around. I have to stop and remind myself many times that even on what I may consider my worst day, there are people who live through worse every day. Do you ever volunteer your time at any charities for kids?
Persuader: I help out at the local Goodwill 2 or 3 times a year, and kids benefit from that so I would say yes.
	Persuadee: That's good. I really enjoy helping kids, its rewarding to see things from their perspective. And refreshing.
Persuader: I agree, kids give an honest view of the world and this can be very refreshing.  And we need to help them.
	Persuadee: Yes, changing the cycle of poverty is something desperately needed. Even if just one child is helped to see that they are more than what their circumstances have to offer its a win.
Persuader: So would you be willing to donate a share of your bonus to Save The Children? The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children.
	Persuadee: I would possibly be interested in donating some of it. I would like to know more about it before I donate.
Persuader: Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.  There is a website  URL 
	Persuadee: thank you for the info. I would donate a portion of the bonus 
Persuader: How much do you like to donate to the charity now? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment.  I myself am giving 0.25.
	Persuadee: I Think 0.25 is a good amount
Persuader: Fantastic, thanks a lot!  This is a great cause, thank you!
	Persuadee: My pleasure glad I can help in some way.

data:
Persuader: Hi there! I am looking for donations for the Save the children's Foundation? Could I interest you in that?
	Persuadee: I would perhaps be interested can you tell me more a bout it
Persuader: It is a charity that helps hungry children in need. It is a international, non governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides releif and support children in developing countries.
	Persuadee: That sounds great, What countries do they help children in?
Persuader: There's quite a few! It's international. Even the smallest donation would make a difference to a child in need.
	Persuadee: Ok I would like to see if I can help. I love children.
Persuader: That's great! They are the future you know... alot of the children are in war zones and facing daily threats of violence.
	Persuadee: Of course nothing gets me more angry then seeing a child warrior soldier. Will we also be helping children soliders?
Persuader: There are no children soliders, only children that need help in some way with food, resources, emergency response, etc. This program has saves a great deal of lives. It has brought families together and gave hope to a new life.
	Persuadee: Ok thats great. Do they need clothes as well? 
Persuader: Yes! Alot of the proceeds go towards garments, shoes, and other things for the children. Some of them are basically naked and have nothing. Others have no shoes. It's really sad, but that's why there are programs out here like us to step in and provide help.
	Persuadee: Ok well I know it is important for them to have basic needs. I hope the money donated goes directly to them and not in the pockets of those running the organization. Are you certain that the money will be used the right way? 
Persuader: 86.5% of it goes towards support program services. And it is also tax deductible
	Persuadee: That sounds like a good percentage and Im glad it will give me a tax break as well. How do you receive payments? credit card? cash?
Persuader: You can donate stock or mutual funds, you can mail it in to a designated address, you can make a payment online with a debit or credit card, PayPal is also an option, there are a ton of ways to get it done!
	Persuadee: Wow that is a lot of options. What would you say is the amount of a the common donation that  someone like myself would donate. I am ready to donate today and would like to know an acceptable donation. 
Persuader: Anything is acceptable! Whatever you feel comfortable! Just keep in mind that the children out here need you! I would suggest $20 a month if you can! If not, whatever you can spare.
	Persuadee: Ok I would like to donate the $20 a month but I would like to hook it up to a credit card that is automatically deducted
Persuader: That's totally fine! Please visit us at  URL to read more and make your first donation!
	Persuadee: Ok, thank you so much for your help. You have made this a good learning experience and I feel confident in my donation to Save The Children.

Persuader: Good Morning! How are you doing today?
	Persuadee: Morning, I am good how about yourself?
Persuader: Oh I'm doing well, thank you very much. I wanted to ask you, have you heard about the charity Save The Children?
	Persuadee: No, I haven't what is it they do?
Persuader: It is an international non-governmental organisation that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries
	Persuadee: That sounds like a great thing they do 
Persuader: Some of their most recent deeds include helping Rohingya Refugees and are still on the ground helping refugees  in Texas after the hurricanes. They are such a great charity that really puts their money towards their cause
	Persuadee: Those are great causes the children are who need the most help I think besides animals anyway
Persuader: Do you think this is something you could see yourself donating to?
	Persuadee: yes, I would donate what I could may not be much but every cent helps right?
Persuader: Absolutely! I completely agree, I mean, we Turk for a reason right?! If the donation was to come out of your current earnings for this task, how much would you be willing to donate?
	Persuadee: I'm sorry if it doesn't sound like much but I could donate 0.05 I'm trying to save for my cats surgery
Persuader: I'm so sorry to hear about your cat. I completely understand, I'm having a root canal done today, that will put me back at least $1100. Yay. But $.05 is great
	Persuadee: you know you say 5 cents and feel a need to explain.... I wish I could do more really I feel so horrible for all the people who have lost everything in the recent natural disasters
Persuader: If you could donate more, do you think this is a worthy cause to do so with?
	Persuadee: I think it is well, if what they say is true and it all goes to kids ( you never know now days) kids are our future 
Persuader: Is there anything specific you'd want your donation to go towards?
	Persuadee: If I had my choice I would start with donating towards the natural disasters like in Texas and then to education for kids, and well, food and a safe place to live, and then to other countries because you can't help other countries if your own nation is falling apart all by itself
Persuader: In an ideal world, where we had all the monies, how much would you be willing to donate to a cause like this?
	Persuadee: In an ideal world, I would do better then donate I would help the people myself, I would go there and help them rebuild, or bring the supplies, or find them shelter..... if we had no concern about limited money I would give everything they needed.

Persuader: Hey!  How are you doing today?
	Persuadee: Hello, im doing well, how about you? 
Persuader: I'm doing okay.  Been reading a lot about all these awful things happening with children lately.  Really bumming me out.  Are you a parent?
	Persuadee: I am I have 2 young children.  I hate hearing about bad things that happen to kids. do you have any children?
Persuader: Same.  I have 2 kids as well.  Just started back to school today, in fact!  As I was packing their lunches I thought about how lucky they are.
	Persuadee: yeah there are so many kids that never get lunch
Persuader: I know.  Not only in this country but in developing countries.  The hunger rates for children in some developing countries is just staggering.
	Persuadee: Yeah its terrible to think about all the kids who go hungry around the world.  not even having clean water is something I cant even fathom and they have to deal with that every day.
Persuader: I know!  It's unreal.  Our children are so fortunate to live where they live and have parents like us.  I'm thankful they don't have to know just how fortunate they are.
	Persuadee: Do you live in the US?  If so, what part of the country are you from?  I'm from Kansas
Persuader: I do.  I'm from Pennsylvania.  How old are your children?
	Persuadee: I have a 2 year old whos almost 3 but acts 13 and a 10 month old.
Persuader: Haha!  I have a 13 year old who acts 2 and a 6 year old who just turned 6 yesterday!  
	Persuadee: That's funny, kids are crazy.  My 2 year old saw a halloween decoration of a witch in the store yesterday and freaked out, then told her to go back to her witch house.   I never know what hes going to say next
Persuader: Those are such fun ages!  It's so great they get to experience all that joy and never have to worry about education, or food, or access to clean water.  I wish I could help every child.  Luckily there are a number of great organizations that assist.
	Persuadee: I agree, I have a couple places I like to donate to.  Its not much but at least i know they use it well.
Persuader: I'm sure you have heard of Save the Children.  They're a pretty solid organization.  In fact, would you consider donating some or all of your payment for this task to them?  
	Persuadee: I haven't heard of them actually.  I'm they are similar to some of the other humanitarian relief organizations out there though.
Persuader: Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.  They have been the world leader in  it for over 100 years.  
	Persuadee: Sounds like a well meaning group, ill have to do some research and learn more about their work.
Persuader: You can check out their website  URL   Your donation today can really help.  And it is put to work immediately.  Especially seeing as how millions of Syrian children have grown up facing the daily threat of violence. In the first two months of 2018 alone, 1,000 children were reportedly killed or injured in intensifying violence
	Persuadee: Unfortunatly I wont be donating anything today.  I will only donate to organizations i have thoroughly researched to see exactly how they are structured, how the use the money and where it all goes.  I just dont have the time to do that right now, but I will definitely look them up for consideration of future donations.

data:
Persuader: I am so livid I just can't stand it right now. Parts of this world are so dark...how can we sit here and do nothing?
	Persuadee: Do nothing about what?
Persuader: These poor suffering children! Did you know that 5.6 million children die each year due to treatable AND preventable diseases?
	Persuadee: That's awful. Are you talking about around the world or in the states? 
Persuader: Around the world! There is so much that could be done..between preventing the spread of aids, reducing the infant mortality rate with proper education and vaccinations, and ensuring access and aid to proper nutrition so many children could be saved.
	Persuadee: I totally agree. There are people helping but its a drop in the bucket. The kids dying is really disturbing. They didn't choose that life. 
Persuader: You are absolutely right. It is disturbing! And yes, it could seem like the aid is a drop in a bucket. However, if we can move the scale one iota and can consider that what that represents is one child having a week of meals or a healthy 3 months than wouldn't you agree that that would be worth any aid that we could provide?
	Persuadee: Absolutely! I think every little bit helps but as a whole it's not enough. Have you ever donated? 
Persuader: I have! And it feels incredible knowing that I have been a part of something greater than myself. It really helps you shift your perspective about your own personal significance on this planet. You realize how infinitely important you are and yet at the same time how infinitely important another person is. When you have the ability to literally change another person's life with something so small...wow, it's life changing.
	Persuadee: That is great! you sound very passionate about this subject. I should do more to help.
Persuader: You should! and you can! I recently have become acquainted with a charity that is actually doing everything we have discussed and is seeing some real results! They have managed to single handedly reduce the infant mortality rate by 62 percent, can you believe that?
	Persuadee: That is an incredible figure!!! 62% is amazing. What is the charity? I may consider a donation.
Persuader: The charity is called Save the Children! Pretty spot on with the name, right? What's really fascinating is that you can actually directly contribute your reward for this task directly to that charity. Pretty convenient.
	Persuadee: That is convenient!!! I will definitely do that. At least a portion of it. 
Persuader: Incredible! I'm so glad we can partner to provide some more light to this ever darkening world. How much do you like to donate to the charity now? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment.
	Persuadee: I need to think about it. 
Persuader: I hear that. It's definitely challenging when confronted with the reality of giving of ourselves as opposed to the hypothetical. But I would suggest that you make the leap. In reality, all this would cost is the time you've spent hear. But oh buddy, think about what you would gain? The peace of mind that comes with knowing that a baby girl in Uganda gets to live for another year or a little boy in Syria gets fed when he didn't think he would have another meal this week. 
	Persuadee: I hear ya! I will donate I'm just not sure how much.
Persuader: Let your heart guide you! I'm really pleased to hear that. Thanks for having an open mind and doing what's right. I wish more people would.
	Persuadee: Thank you! you have been great.

Persuader: Have you heard about Save the Children?
	Persuadee: Yes I have, seems like a good org
Persuader: It really is. Donations help individual children and their families.It ensures health, education and safety.
	Persuadee: I always wonder about the overhead and admin costs that come off the top of donations
Persuader: A lot of organizations seem to have issues with overhead. I was amazed to see that over 86 percent goes into their programs. Only 5% is for management and 9% to fundraising.
	Persuadee: Those are good numbers, shows that most of the money goes to the kids and not big salaries.
Persuader: 44 percent alone goes to health, nutrition, and hunger. In 2017 alone, they reached 155million children. 237K in the U.S
	Persuadee: That's fantastic, they've helped a lot!
Persuader: And sadly, there is still so much more to do. In just one area, Syria, millions of Syrian children have grown up facing the daily threat of violence. n the first two months of 2018 alone, 1,000 children were reportedly killed or injured!
	Persuadee: I would be afraid aid meant to be given to the children would be seized by those in power and never reach the kids.
Persuader: I had wondered about that myself. They work closely with the U.N  and other organizations in the local area to be sure it gets to those in need and not the aggressors. 
	Persuadee: Hopefully those organizations aren't as corrupt as has been reported in the media.  You just don't know what to believe any more.
Persuader: That is true. This one seems to have been around for awhile and seems to be highly rated though. Have you ever had a chance to donate to Save the Children?
	Persuadee: Yes, years ago I remember a presentation and we did donate then.  I have since been donating to local animal rescue groups.  They really need the help.
Persuader: Yeah, I have donated little amounts here and there as I can. Though the shelters everywhere seem to need help as well! I give little bits when I can. Would you be interested in giving a small donation??
	Persuadee: I would definitely consider it.
Persuader: Any little bit helps any of these organizations. Everyone's little bits add up to so much more!
	Persuadee: You are right.  How much do you think I should donate to Save the Children?
Persuader: There is a way to have one deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment ($2). I personally do a little when I really need the money. Anywhere from a dime to a quarter. When I read something devastating, earned a good amount at work or feel better financially, it is more. 
	Persuadee: Okay, thanks for your input.  I will donate $1.00
Persuader: Wow! That is amazing! They will be glad to have it!!!

data:
Persuader: Hello friend! 
	Persuadee: Hi! So what is an issue that is important in your life today?
Persuader: I am here to talk to you about an important organization called Save the Children. I am not affiliated with them in any way
	Persuadee: What is Save the Children's mission?
Persuader: Save the Children is a international not-for-profit organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries
	Persuadee: What percent of donations actually get to children, not for administrative costs?
Persuader: All proceeds go directly the the children. The organization is not-for-profit. In fact, you can sponsor an individual child from countries all around the world who does not have the sustenance to survive
	Persuadee: What advantages does the donation go toward? Food, housing, schooling, etc.?
Persuader: Thank you for asking! Save the Children is a very interesting organization because you can provide specific needs to go the childre n including animals (goats, chicks, cows), education tuition, health essentials (vitamins, vaccinations, etc.), clean water faucets, and even purchase livestock for a whole village! However, your individual donation would be combined with another to purchase one of these necesities for the child  
	Persuadee: Wow! That's very diverse. My son's youth group sometimes buys a chicken, goat, etc. for children in developing countries, which I think does well for helping them sustain themselves. So how did you get involved with Save the Children?
Persuader: That's incredible! God bless them! I am not personally associated with Save the Children, I just wanted to promote their organization because I think it is very noble and a fantastic cause.
	Persuadee: I think a lot of times we take our lives for granted in the United States. I have all kinds of "first world problems" that seem miniscule in comparison to real problems like not having enough to eat, not having clean water, and not having shelter and safety. It\'s good to think outside of yourself.
Persuader: You hit it right on the head. I have come to realize that most people would do anything to have the "problems" that we have in our daily lives. Not saying that they\'re aren\'t real problems in our society, but like you said, they are miniscule compared to what could be. With that being said, would you consider donating a portion of your task donation to Save the Children? You can donate any amount of your payment ($0-$2), any bit helps
	Persuadee: I would be willing to donate something, $.50. I know that's not much, but putting it with others' donations it might be helpful in some way.
Persuader: Absolutely! Like I said, any bit helps. Any donation is very generous and greatly appreciated by Save the Children.
	Persuadee: Fifty cents it is then. I appreciate your helping me understand more about Save the Children. One more question, how many countries is Save the Children associated with?
Persuader: No problem! Thank you for listening! In regards to your question, Save the Children reaches more than 155 million children in 120 countries, including the U.S.
	Persuadee: It sounds like a very worthwhile organization and I am happy to make a donation today:)
Persuader: Thank you very much, both for your donation and your time. I hope you have a fantastic day!
	Persuadee: You too! Enjoy your Labor Day!

Persuader: Hello....how are you?
	Persuadee: Hi, how's it going? I'm not bad, tired though
Persuader: I feel the same. It's been a long day.
	Persuadee: Yeah... so what are we supposed to talk about, as far as social issues?
Persuader: Well, there is a charity called Save The Children that is desperate for donations no matter how small to help children in war torn and third world countries. How do you feel about that?
	Persuadee: I've heard about the organization. I guess I would be willing to make a small donation towards the org, but I wish the process of how the money gets to these countries was more transparent
Persuader: I know what you mean but I'm willing to donate a little. I keep thinking that if everyone just gave $1 how that could add up to really help some poor kids. I was lucky to have everything I needed when I was growing up. I would like to try to help someone else.
	Persuadee: Yeah, I grew up pretty poor, not third world poor, but I know what it\'s like to go hungry. It\'s terrible and there really is enough wealth in the world to "solve" poverty. Honestly governments and corporations could work together to do this, but yeah, every person donating say $1 a day of course makes a difference too
Persuader: How much would you like to donate to the charity now? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment which is $2.
	Persuadee: I'll donate $0.10.
Persuader: Ok, thanks! The research team will collect all donations and send them to Save The Children.
	Persuadee: Awesome, thanks for chatting.
Persuader: Thanks, have a nice day!
	Persuadee: You too. Bye!
Persuader: I think we have to chat a bit longer. I think we're supposed to each do 10 chats and we've only done 7.
	Persuadee: Oh ok, it says to go until a donation agreement is reached. How much will you donate? 
Persuader: I'm willing to donate $1.
	Persuadee: You're very generous. 1/2 your payment. Going by the tithing rule (10%), I should have donated $0.20. :)
Persuader: I just feel that I like to share since it is money I didn't expect to make in the first place. There's always someone out there who has it worse than I do by far and if $1 helps it will make me feel good to help even just a little.
	Persuadee: True, true, that makes sense. I guess I'm more pragmatic. Sure, there are people out there who have it relatively worse than us, but it's still a struggle, and I can't justify giving up half my earnings. I mean, for me, this is my side income (Mturk). Anyway, hope we're close to 10 chats
Persuader: We finally did the 10 chats! Thanks for your donation! Every little bit does help. Goodbye!

	Persuadee: May I ask for what cause is it for? 
Persuader: Whatever amount you choose to donate from your payment for this taks will be donated to a children's cahrtiy called Save the Children. Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and hleps support children in developing countries.
	Persuadee: I see. I guess I can donate $0.20 for now, as I am not guaranteed of how much I will be paid for this task. I really want to support Save the Children since I'm expecting my first child this December and I believe children are a gift from GOD and they should be cherished and taken care of.
Persuader: Any amount you choose to give will be greatly appreciated. I'm not that exact how much we are going to get paid for this task. I didn't read all instructions carefully lol. Aw that's kinda cool. How old are you??
	Persuadee: Haha. I read that if we finish like 10 responses to each other, the task can be considered a success. I\'m 33 y/o, by the way. It\'s so cool considering that my husband and I only tried getting pregnant in just 2 months after our wedding. We had a long boyfriend/girlfriend relationship before getting married. 9 years to be exact. So this "little one" is really a gift from GOD in JESUS\' Name. How about you, tell me something about yourself.
Persuader: I'm 28 years old. Born and raised in Texas. My boyfriend doesn't want to have children until he has his career secured.
	Persuadee: Nice. I haven\'t been to Texas. I\'m from California and would love to visit Texas after giving birth. Well, your boyfriend\'s right at some point. It is pretty expensive to have a child these days, anyway. But as they say, "you can never be ready" =) So, I think any time is a good time to have babies. If you don\'t mind me asking, how do you feel about your boyfriend\'s decision? I\'d understand if you don\'t want to talk about it 
Persuader: Well I dont want to have children I prefer adopting one or two. And he is okay with that decision. Yeah you are right, raising children these days are tough. So many expenses. Good thing we have different charities that help out children all over the world, for example, Save the Children. 
	Persuadee: I know, right! I just looked up their website and I didn't know they were helping a LOT of children all over the world. It's nice to hear/read stories of hope especially for our younger generation. I know you'd agree with me when I say being a child nowadays is tougher than our time. So much cyber-bullying, etc. Anyway, back to Save the Children, I think they're doing a pretty good job and would read more about them and their advocacies
Persuader: I blame technology! lol Save the Children is an amazing charity because it really helps people in need. I also went to their websites and read couple of things
	Persuadee: True! Anyways, this has been an eye-opening task. Fulfilling and rewarding at the same time, knowing that we have contributed even a small bit to their cause. I think we can submit this now, don't you think? how do we do that anyway? haha
Persuader: I dont' think we can submit right now I guess we should continue
	Persuadee: Oh okay. hmmm, maybe we really have to have at least 10 chat responses to each other. This is going to be my 9th so let's see. I think we've spent a good amount of time on this one
Persuader: I know. I guess I have to ask you: How much do you like to donate to the charity now? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment ($2).
	Persuadee: I see. I can donate $0.20
Persuader: now we finished lol
	Persuadee: It was the 10 chat turns! lol. it was nice chatting with you! May GOD richly bless you and your boyfriend! You can click DONE now. Thanks again

Persuader: Hi, I'm happy to start this chat with you and I am writing to appeal to you regarding donating some or all of your hit earned to Save the Children. Have you heard of this organization?
	Persuadee: YES, I BELIEVE I HAVE
Persuader: It is literally one of the most trusted organizations in the world for assisting children of all nations to be fed, clothed, educated and safe. A hit reward is a relatively tiny amount, but with many donations, it adds up. Do you think you would be willing to donate your earnings from this hit to needy children?
	Persuadee: POSSIBLE, I ALREADY DONATE TO MANY.  NOT SURE IF IT'S YOU OR THE SYSTEM, BUT I ONLY HAVE A FEW MIN.  PLEASE RESPOND QUICKLY
Persuader: We have to type 10 responses each to move on. I don't know what you already donate to, but this cause seems pressing, especially due to war torn countries around the world.
	Persuadee: THAT IS TRUE, IT SOUNDS LIKE A GREAT CHARITY.  AND WE DO NEED 10 BUT  SOULDN'T TAKE 30 MIN.  I THINK THERE SYSTEM IS SLOW
Persuader: Very slow! So if you commit to donating, we can end this quicker. What do you say? $1?
	Persuadee: I WILL DO 50 CENTS
Persuader: Ok. Every little bit helps. Now we just need to talk a bit more.
	Persuadee: Do you know how much of every dollar the charity gets?
Persuader: I know that the donations collected here go directly to the charity and it is a non-profit organization.
	Persuadee: That doesn't mean it's run well.
Persuader: That is true, but according to what I have read, it seems to be a very good one.
	Persuadee: I hope so.  I hate when the charity gets pennies on the dollar
Persuader: Same! I really hate seeing children suffer too. It's so far removed from how our lives are.
	Persuadee: yes, we take so much for granted
Persuader: Exactly. It's hard for me to wrap my head around some of the images I see on TV.
	Persuadee: yes, so hopefully they get all the money
Persuader: Yes, I agree. So you are doing 50 cents, just to confirm? And I think we might be done.
	Persuadee: yes, 50 cents.  thanks 
Persuader: Thank you iso much!
